rules.name: Accurate x
rules.description: You can retain up to x attack dice as normal successes without rolling them[cite: 136]. If a weapon has multiple instances, treat it as Accurate 2[cite: 137].

rules.name: Balanced
rules.description: You can re-roll one of your attack dice[cite: 138].

rules.name: Blast x
rules.description: After shooting the primary target, shoot against each secondary target visible to and within x of the primary target (e.g., Blast 2")[cite: 139, 140, 141]. Secondary targets are valid regardless of a Conceal order[cite: 142].

rules.name: Brutal
rules.description: Your opponent can only block with critical successes[cite: 143].

rules.name: Ceaseless
rules.description: You can re-roll any of your attack dice results of one specific result (e.g., all results of 2)[cite: 143].

rules.name: Devastating x
rules.description: Each retained critical success immediately inflicts x damage on the operative[cite: 144]. If the rule includes a distance (e.g., 1" Devastating x), inflict that damage on the target and every other operative visible within that distance[cite: 145].

rules.name: Heavy
rules.description: An operative cannot move in the same activation or counteraction it uses this weapon, and vice versa[cite: 146]. If specified as 'Heavy (x only)', only that specific move action is allowed[cite: 147].

rules.name: Hot
rules.description: After using this weapon, roll one D6: if the result is lower than the weapon's Hit stat, the operative takes damage equal to the result multiplied by two[cite: 149].

rules.name: Lethal x+
rules.description: Attack dice results equal to or greater than x are critical successes (e.g., Lethal 5+)[cite: 151].

rules.name: Limited x
rules.description: The weapon can only be used a number of times equal to x during the battle[cite: 152].

rules.name: Piercing x
rules.description: The defender rolls x fewer defence dice[cite: 154]. 'Piercing Crits x' only applies if you retain critical successes[cite: 155].

rules.name: Punishing
rules.description: If you retain any critical successes, you can retain one failed die as a normal success instead of discarding it[cite: 156].

rules.name: Range x
rules.description: Only operatives within distance x of the active operative can be valid targets[cite: 157].

rules.name: Relentless
rules.description: You can re-roll any of your attack dice[cite: 158].

rules.name: Rending
rules.description: If you retain any critical successes, you can change one retained normal success into a critical success[cite: 159].

rules.name: Saturate
rules.description: The defender cannot retain cover saves against this weapon[cite: 160].

rules.name: Seek
rules.description: When selecting targets, operatives with a Conceal order cannot use terrain for cover[cite: 161]. 'Seek Light' only ignores Light terrain for cover[cite: 162].

rules.name: Severe
rules.description: If you do not retain any critical successes, you can change one normal success into a critical success[cite: 164].

rules.name: Shock
rules.description: The first time you strike with a critical success in a sequence, discard one of the opponent's unresolved normal successes (or a critical if no normal successes remain)[cite: 166].

rules.name: Silent
rules.description: The operative can perform a Shoot action with this weapon even while it has a Conceal order[cite: 167].

rules.name: Stun
rules.description: If you retain any critical successes, subtract 1 from the target operative's APL stat until the end of its next activation[cite: 168].

rules.name: Torrent x
rules.description: Select a primary target, then shoot against any number of other valid targets within distance x of that target (but not within control range of your friendly operatives)[cite: 169, 170].
